      • GetProperty

        public static java.lang.String GetProperty(java.lang.String key,
                                           java.lang.Object defValue)
        Returns the Configured Property value for the client scope, or a default value, if the property is not set.
        Parameters:
        key - Configuration Key of the property
        defValue - Default Value to use if the property is not set.
        Returns:
        property value if it is set, or defValue if it is not set
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if a property key is not configured and strict mode is enabled

      • GetConfigurationGroups

        public static IConfigurationElement[] GetConfigurationGroups()
        Returns the Top level Configuration Groups. Think of Configuration Groups like a Folder Structure. The method call always returns the Groups of the root node.
        Returns:
        Array of IConconfigureElement nodes

      • GetConfigurationRoot

        public static Group GetConfigurationRoot()
        Returns the top level configuration group. This group contains the configurated application groups in the configuration metadata system.
        Returns:
        Group Root Configuration Group

      • GetConfiguration

        Returns the Configuration Group for the given group id
        Parameters:
        groupId - Group Id for the configuration
        Returns:
        Group or null if there is no group.

      • GetConfigurationParent

        public static Group GetConfigurationParent(IConfigurationElement el)
        Returns the Parent Group to which this element belongs, or null, if there is no parent.
        Parameters:
        el - IConfigurationElement configuration element (field or group)
        Returns:
        parent Group or null if there is no parent.

      • GetConfigurationChildren

        public static IConfigurationElement[] GetConfigurationChildren(Group parent)
        Get all Configuration Elements of the given group. A Configuration Element can either be a Group or Field.
        Parameters:
        parent - Parent Group from which you want to get the Configuration Elements
        Returns:
        Array of IConfigurationElement nodes, or null if there are no children, or if the parent is null

      • IsConfigurationGroup

        public static boolean IsConfigurationGroup(IConfigurationElement e)
        Returns true of the element is a Group Element. You can think of Group elements like Folders. Group Elements contain Children that can either be another Group or a Field
        Parameters:
        e - IConfigurationElement that you want to test
        Returns:
        true if the element is a Group

      • IsConfigurationApplication

        public static boolean IsConfigurationApplication(IConfigurationElement e)
        Returns true if the Configuration Element is a top level application element. Application Elements are Also Group Elements, but they are a special type of Group. Application Elements are basically the parent of a collection of related groups. ie, "sage" would be an Application Element that contains all the configuration items for SageTV. "phoenix" would be an Application Element that contains all the configuration items for Phoenix.
        Parameters:
        e - IConfigurationElement that you are testing
        Returns:
        true if this element is an Application Element

      • IsConfigurationField

        public static boolean IsConfigurationField(IConfigurationElement e)
        Returns true if this element is a Configuration Field. A Configuration Field is a child of a Group and contains information about the configurable item. It holds information such as it's default value, field type, configuration key, etc.
        Parameters:
        e - IConfigurationElement that you are testing
        Returns:
        true if this element is a Field

      • GetConfigurationLabel

        public static java.lang.String GetConfigurationLabel(IConfigurationElement g)
        Returns the localized Label for the Configuration Element. This can be an Application, Group, of Field.
        Parameters:
        g - Configuration Element from which you want to get a Localized Label
        Returns:
        Localized label for the given Configuration Element

      • GetConfigurationDescription

        public static java.lang.String GetConfigurationDescription(IConfigurationElement g)
        Returns the localized Description for the Configuration Element. This can be an Application, Group, of Field.
        Parameters:
        g - Configuration Element from which you want to get a Localized Description
        Returns:
        Localized description for the given Configuration Element

      • GetConfigurationFieldType

        public static java.lang.String GetConfigurationFieldType(IConfigurationElement e)

        Parameters:
        e - IConfigurationElement
        Returns:
        field's type as a string value

      • GetConfigurationDefaultValue

        public static java.lang.String GetConfigurationDefaultValue(IConfigurationElement e)
        Returns the field's default value as a String. A field's default value is determined from the defaultValue attribute of the field in the configuration metadata xml
        Parameters:
        e - IConfigurationElement
        Returns:
        default value of the element as a String

      • GetConfigurationKey

        public static java.lang.String GetConfigurationKey(IConfigurationElement e)
        Return the unique key that identifies this Configuration Field. This is the key that this Field uses in it's property file. All IConfigurationElement's must be unique the system.
        Parameters:
        e - IConfigurationElement
        Returns:
        Key for this Element

      • ReloadConfiguration

        public static void ReloadConfiguration()
        This is a debug method that can be used to reload the configuration and configuration metadata without requiring a complete SageTV restart. The main use for this would be when you are developing in the STV and you need a new property, you can edit the metadata xml and then reload the configuration so that you can carry forward and use that new configuration item without have to restart SageTV.

        This API call will probably be hidden once the project is released.

        Returns:
        true if the item is the "New Search" configuration group item

      • HasOptions

        public static boolean HasOptions(Field f)
        Returns true if the configuration field has possible selection options. For boolean types this will also return true, and you will have 2 possible options for "true" and "false".
        Parameters:
        f -
        Returns:

      • GetOptions

        public static java.util.List GetOptions(Field f)
        Returns the Options for a given field. May be null or empty. For booleans this will also return list of 2 items for "true" and "false"
        Parameters:
        f -
        Returns:

      • GetOptionLabel

        public static java.lang.String GetOptionLabel(Field field,
                                              java.lang.Object value,
                                              java.lang.String defLabel)
        A convenience method to lookup an option's Label for a given value. For example, you can find the label for a boolean field using GetOptionLable(field, "true", "OK").
        Parameters:
        field - Configuration Field
        value - option value
        defLabel - default label to return if the option's label is null, or the option does not exist.
        Returns:

      • IsSelected

        public static boolean IsSelected(NamedValue option,
                                 Field field,
                                 java.lang.Object curValue)
        Returns true the the option's value is in the field's curValue list. ie, The option is selected because the field's current value is the same as the option. This should work for both Single Choice and Multi Choice options. For example, if the fields's current value is "12;24"
        Parameters:
        field -
        curValue -
        option -
        Returns:

      • CreateOptionList

        public static java.util.List<NamedValue> CreateOptionList(java.lang.Object data)
        Returns a List of NamedValue object, that can be used as configuration option choices. The data can be a list, map, array, etc, and it will convert to the List of NamedValue objects.
        Parameters:
        data -
        Returns:

      • Toggle

        public static void Toggle(java.lang.String prop)
        Same as Toggle(Field) except uses the property Key.
        Parameters:
        prop -

      • Toggle

        public static void Toggle(Field f)
        For a boolean field it will toggle between true and false. For Choice options, it will toggle to next value in the choice. ie, if the choices are "1", "2", and "3", then calling Toggle when the value is "2" will set the value to "3", and calling Toggle when the value is "3" will set the value to "1".

        If field can't be toggled then nothing happens.

        Parameters:
        f - Field to toggle
